dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sparkling waters. The chirping spring day. We are on stretch of country shore , and a quiet, sheltered island distantly across the Sound. There is asense of anticipati excitement. VOICES can be heard. THE CAMERA is the POV of CAMERA, and a group of college kids wait just o.s. On-scr for the moment, a proper, sweet-faced young COED faces th -- reluctantly, under the urging of her friend behind the - sets the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... My name is Mary O'Reilly O'Toole O'Shea and...over island my friend Muffy owns... It's spring break... and s us over for the weekend, and we're waiting for the ferry us there... (blushing, mortified to cameraman) I don't know what else to say!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAMAN, (CHAZ'S VOICE)
dialogues.text: Tell us something about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about myself? Oh, Gee... (composing herself, earnestly) Well, I want to work with handicapped children... My pare best Friends... Next semester I start convent school, and the first date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.S. her friends explode with LAUGHTER. Brassy former deb BRASHEARS gives us a big, wet wink, dropping the act.

dialogues.speaker: SWEET COED/NIKKI
dialogues.text: April Fool...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoo! Outrageous woman! Nikki, you are my kind o' gal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PANS THE CAMERA over to KIT-- a pretty, unaffected, na bright and very much aware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Kit, how about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit waves him off, laughing in spite of herself. She's go say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon , Arch? Skip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PANS over to the other two college boys on the dock he big, good-natured, easygoing WASP jock (rugby and crew); Preppy, the perfect image of the lazy spoiled, indulged, upper-crust kid. Skip also happens to be Muffy's cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ponders it with due consideration) Yeah, sure... I fuck on the first date...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip cracks up. Arch's laughter follows.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Where's Rob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz QUICK-PANS the camera back to Kit, following the act

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing, with innuendo) Yeah, Kit, where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Kit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concerned, Kit keeps her humor anyway, waving the lens aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon, Chaz, give me some room, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does, finally shutting down the videopak. The image re again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her, persisting) Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver -- a still great-looking, turned-out Fairfield SUBURBAN LADY -- and the passenger, ROB FERRIS a cleancut goodlooking, 20 year old public school grad В­sit in unco silence on opposite ends of the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures, awkwardly) Here'll be fine, thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Volvo wagon pulls over. Rob drags out his daypack, to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... for the lift, I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, no reason for disappointment) It was a real lift for me, too, hon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A late model Detroit sedan slows at the intersection, tur highway to take the junction in the direction Rob is goin sign indicates: "BAR HARBOR MOUNT DESERT" in another dire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob hefts his gear, hurrying to flag the sedan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Volvo wagon continues on, braking for the next underg male hitchhiking down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a wall calendar. A HAND reaches INTO FRAME, tear "MARCH" to begin "APRIL".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN TO REVEAL CLARA, the middle-aged housekeeper and of caretaker for the house. With her overcoat and purse on o drops the "MARCH" calendar page in a wastebasket, then cr pantry where a door and wooden steps lead down to the bas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rooms are all in order, double- and triple-checked, a way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears a CLATTER from down below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUFFY ST. JOHN drags a woman's body across the floor. The off in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need any help down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara comes clopping down the steps. Muffy turns, the man still in her hand. Old workclothes and a head kerchief ta of Muffy's normally impeccable prep Seven Sisters outfit the regulation penny loafers) in all this dust. Early 20' an off-beat sort of way, Muffy is every inch a blue-blood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puffing with the effort) No, Clara, thanks. Just trying some last minute straighte here... god, I don't think I've ever worked so hard in my

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you don't want me to stay? There's nobody gonna be a here to help till first ferry back Monday, y'know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing with her work) Nope, you're a peach, Clara. But this one's mine. I told do it, and I will. My way. I don't want him to have any e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dubiously , turning to go) All right, then. Have a nice party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a buoyant laugh) Nice? It has to be better than nice... it's gotta be bloo unforgettable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Clara. See you Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon there's the upstairs SOUND of the kitchen door closi Clara. Muffy finally props the mannequin, clearing away the rema clutter. She goes to open a basement window for ventilati ground-level transom, hinged at the top. Through it Clara departing the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Muffy hears a DRIPPING. She turns, hesitating, and f sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of the basement, an old washroom and more, with tub, and large incinerator. Muffy enters, pulling the chain on overhead bulb. It illuminates the room, and the tub under slightly rusty at the drain, but otherwise spotless -- an dripping faucet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAZ, the videocameraman and the only member of the group seen till now, is the first to spot the ferry approaching

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here she comes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a real hi-tech freak and Ivy League wiseass, a free neo-punk neck curl and button-down shirt. He shoulders hi videopak again, taping it. Arch and Skip watch with him f of the pier. But Kit and Nikki, waiting nearer the office distracted by the SOUND of an arriving car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Rob, though. It's NAN, another newcomer. She pul next to the others in the gravel lot behind the landing o gets out quickly, dragging a hefty suitcase out of the ba is an unfamiliar face to Kit and Nikki --a shy, earnest, girl, overdressed for the occasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... is this the ferry to the St. John house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any second now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank goodness ! I didn't know if I was on the right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit smiles welcome, lending a hand as Nan struggles the b ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Kit Graham... Nikki Brashears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nan Youngblood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (needling, about the suitcase) Planning on staying a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flushes, embarrassed) Oh, no... just some work for finals, when we get back... know how far behind I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch outhustles Chaz for her bag. Her simple attractivene appeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Arch Cummings . I've seen you around. Jewett Hall, ri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz Vyshinsky. You got great legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointed1y, reminds him) Chaz, Arch already has her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning, Chaz is Nikki's man, especially for this weekend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (volunteering, happily) Well, I only met Muffy this term in Drama Society . I vol do their costumes... I like to sew... Did you see her in so talented. She was wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nan, approvingly; in greeting) Congratulations, on finding your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landing BUMPS, the ferry touches down. They look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large, raw-boned FERRYMAN holds open the wooden stile and only passenger from the island В­ Clara -- to disemba passes them , giving first Skip and then the others a loo her head in sad appraisal. FERRYMAN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the friendliest greeting in the world. The ferry stile open for them to board singly. There is also a youn on board -- BUCK, a pleasant, openfaced townie in his 20s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRYMAN (cont.) To the rear. Outa the operator's way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki clutches at Skip's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it? No going back? Trapped for days on an island men are men, and women oughta know better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to control yourself, Sister O'Toole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could tie me in chains...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz boards, passing Buck, the assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a low whisper) Your fly's open, and your Hostess Twinkie's hanging out..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assistant gapes, falling for it, groping his fly. Whi of course. He looks up, grinning. Chaz kisses him on the and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh -i-i-t...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit is hanging back on the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on if you're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. But we're still waiting for somebody --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Friday. My last run of the week. I don't get paid ov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've got to wait. They said it's the only way over. If he misses this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch WHISTLES loudly, seeing and alerting them.

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: A late model Detroit sedan (the one we saw earlier turnin highway) pulls to a fast stop in the lot. Rob hurries out comes up from the group on the ferry. Kit closes her eyes Rob comes hurrying up the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...followed closely by HARVEY 'HAL' EDISON, JR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey is the driver of the sedan, and after he carefully comes running with his bag, too. He is a rangy, straight- League farmboy from the Border South, and he's the last o invited guests. He also, somewhat incongruously, sports a Springsteen badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kit, kissing her) Sorry... Nik, Chaz... (to Skip and Nan whom he doesn't know) Rob Ferris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They return greetings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! Harvey 'Hal' Edison, Jr., but please call me Hal. Onl call me Harve... and I can't stand it. Boy, this sure is spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stylistically, he's a Martian. Chaz stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're friends with... Muffy St. John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure am. We sit together in Econ 345. I let her copy my m utility curves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it. That's a joke. Preppy Skip adds his greeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an ironical nod) Harve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting him, blithely) Hal... (noticing interest his badge) Springsteen, he's still the Boss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, c'mon, I don't have all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the stile down after Harvey, the last to board, with the stubborn motor. His assistant helps. Chaz tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastically, putting down his fear) YOU all buddies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for Skip and Nan. Them we just met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch what you say around him, though. He's Muffy's cousi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tickled, to Skip) No kiddin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distant. Over the horizon. Otherwise, I wouldn't be invited... (frowns, tellingly) Old money never mixes family with friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is true. For as long as I've known her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To protect her family, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep her friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Arch, holds up his hand, and CLICK, a switchb into the lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKIP (cont.) Choose your weapons, big guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously, a laugh) Hey, what's this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You up for a game of stretch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still taping, to Skip) Your fly's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (undaunted, to Rob) Your fly's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, so don't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps the tape rolling. Rob discreetly looks down. His open. Kit looks at him dubiously. Rob zips. Chaz beams, g for posterity. The engine finally engages. The ferry lurc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles weakly to Kit) We're off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferry pulls away from the mainland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLOSER ANGLE. The sturdy, barge like ship craft makes p Ferryman and Buck remain at the stern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Skip's knife flies INTO FRAME, it bites into the board

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at their game. Arch stretches, can't reach the knife, and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip hoots triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First round, the champ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki, much to her chagrin, finds herself the object of H attentions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know what I find amazin'? Muffy's her real name. I mean I'm Harvey, but they call me Hal, so I thought, 'Muffy', stand for something... Muffin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffers, Moffo, Muff-child , Muffin' stuff, the Muffster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you're her oldest friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, she's three months older than I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey... are you planning a career in politics when you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've given it some thought. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just a hunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, though, I'm hopin' to interview with her daddy's company, Southern Regional Sales, next year before gradua Y'know, he's worth more'n 50 mill over the counter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: digging into the deck again.

dialogues.speaker: ARCH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCH and SKIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knife is at an impossible distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it, big fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch swallows his pride and makes a hopeless attempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fastens onto Nan, immersed in one of her books. He carrie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting beside her) Whatcha readin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton. Paradise Lost. For Professor Russo's course on th English epic... It's a shame. It's a dying form. Not too read it nowadays, even in college. What's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck and fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naked bodies writhing in heat. Women with their tongues s in desparate desire... Nan tries to control her reaction of graphic pornographic video catalogues and magazines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The origins of American pornographic film. I'm taking an independent study this term. (the passion and commitment show) My advisor's really behind me on it. We're not gonna be s college kids all our lives. Someday I'm gonna have kids - you're gonna have kids В­ and someday that kid's gonna co to me and say, 'God, Dad, porn's really a major part of o lives. You were there, how'd it get started?' I wanna be able to answer their questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, it's research I can do by myself.

dialogues.speaker: ROB AND KIT
dialogues.text: They keep their voices low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not my point --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want me to hitch, you want me to buy a car. OK, I'm a state university boy, I don't have the perks like s of you private college kids do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon, don't pull that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob just drops his arms in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIT (cont.) I mean, it may show something about your attitude toward always being late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch's voice interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed, loudly, overriding the other conversations) Hey, I'm really not interested anymore --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, just one more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others look up at the interruption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch pushes the knife back into Skip's hand, tired of pla toss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, enough's enough--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more try, double or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips the knife to Arch, handle first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, give it a fuckin' rest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips it back hard. Something happens. Skip looks up s Arch's voice catches in his throat in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip stares back, disbelieving, looking down and pulling from his chest, where the blood begins to seep and the ja sticks out, buried hilt-deep between his ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nan screams. Skip stumbles, teetering there at the edge o Rob and Chaz leap to their feet. The ferrymen both look u disbelief. Arch steps forward to help. But Skip, weaving, splashes overboard. He goes under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked, hurrying to the side) I'll get him, I'll get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he stops just at the edge of the ferry, immobilized b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob rushes forward, with Chaz in reserve, pulling Arch ou way. But Buck, the assistant ferryman, pre-empts them all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch, frozen, watches from the deck with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck resurfaces, but without any sign of Skip. Rob doesn' longer. He pulls off his shoes and dives in. Chaz gets re suit. The panic mounts. Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, this what you're looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip pulls himself up, dripping, on the other side of the holds up the knife -- and the padded sash beneath his shi imbed the knife -- and grins from ear to ear. The others totally freaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch lets go, jumping in the air. Rob and Buck surface, t well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got 'em! Whoo-ee, did we nail 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as it dawns, to Skip) April Fools... you crazy jerks. You crazy motherfuckin' j somebody could've gotten hurt out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relief descends. Rob isn't laughing. But nobody's more im assistant Buck, still treading water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You maniacs... you almost gave us a heart attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit glowers at them and gives Rob a hand to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least we don't go in for this your-shoelaceВ­is-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dripping, to Arch and Skip) I owe you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, to Buck in the water) How's it goin' out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was really counting on these other turkeys to save my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip extends a hand to Buck to help him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Buck's in no hurry. The ferryman steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unamused, to Buck) Ok, c'mon, get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are approaching the landing dock on the island.

dialogues.speaker: FERRYMAN, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (to Buck, gruffly) C'mon I'm gonna need some help here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck obeys, but his way, enjoying it, ducking under the c to the other side to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And watch out for the wire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. There's a sickening THUMP I The young assistant breaks the surface qf the water, panicked and stunned, ga air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens too fast for any of them to do anything. Buck dazed, off-balance, falling back into the path of the fer glides toward the landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck, look out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferryman grabs the controls, but it can't help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferry, unstoppable, plows into Buck, pinning him agai the piers. Buck screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferryman rushes forward to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment the others are spared the horror of it as th Ferryman's back blocks their view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then Buck, thrashing in the water, tears himself, loo and bobbing. up, his head and torso covered in blood, the face and his shoulder hideously deformed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is awful. It is ghastly. And it is unforgettable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM POTTER, the middle-aged township constable, hears the the screams. He drops what he's doing in his outboard and running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferryman jumps into the shallow water, pulling Buck o Rob, Chaz and Arch jump after to help, but the ferryman p angrily away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck is hysterical. The gashes of torn flesh seem to drip skull. Seeing Rob and the others, he screams, lunging vai in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did it... them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy Buck... it's OK... OK... There's time for Later... easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's hard for him to restrain his own rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable Potter arrives, throwing the ferryman a towel t ferryman catches it, pressing it against Buck's torn face maddened, glaring eye still stares out hideously at the g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him to the hospital, Cal! Take my boat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps the ferryman lift Buck. But the powerful ferryma further help, carrying Buck to the Constable's motorboat nearby, laying Buck in, untying the line and pulling the life. Buck continues to shriek, terrifyingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferryman cast one last glance back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of the motorboat fades away. Potter turns back stunned group, eyeing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... Let's have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffy drives up. She slows, seeing, through the windshiel scene at the pier... her friends in troubled conversation Constable Potter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffy gets out, parking the new van beside an old island is kept at the dock. She's clean, and dressed in her more garb. She approaches.

dialogues.text: Muffy, undressing, hears, and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch is pacing the bedroom, horny and alone. He gets an i rummages through Chaz' stuff and comes up with a video ca porno movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying -the cassette he crosses to the door and turns t The doorknob comes off in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws it down in disgust, goes and sits in a chair an chair collapses beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip makes his way boldly, carelessly, drunkenly along. O weeds and tall spring grass choke the path, shadowing his takes one last drink, killing the bottle, and hurls it ou night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long pause there is the distant sound O.S. of the landing in water with a splash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip emerges from the overgrowth. The abandoned old struc dock squat ahead at water's edge. Beneath the boathouse, the water, is a grungy old skiff covered by a tarp. Skip turns away from the dock, and flicks his lighter amo finding marijuana growing there. He CACKLES with triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something MOVES nearby. He doesn't pay attention, taking to cull the dried leaves. He cups them in his hand agains douses his lighter, and hurries out onto the dock to the entrance to prepare his joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Skip enters. It is pitch black in here, and aside from lapping sounds of water against the pilings down below O. still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip flips a lightswitch in the darkness and nothing happ slowly along a wall away from the door. Then he becomes a another living presence in the boathouse. It is a slow br sound--completely inhuman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer, but the breathing continues. Then a s sound very near, like a foot striking the wood flooring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. No answer. We hear in the darkness the sound of hi clicking open. And then he waits, straining his ears to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Skip reaches into his pocket, puils out his ligh and flicks it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something snags him from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip gasps, helpless, as a thick rope controlled by power hands tightens around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His knife, dried leaves and lighter cascade to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the porch light remains glowing. The house is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob wakes, hearing the CRY from Muff's room. Kit, naked a wakes too. They hear the muffled cry again. It is not fro Rob throws off the covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob wraps himself with a towel, stepping quickly out to M Everything else is dark and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed, at door) Muffy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. He tries her door, but it's locked tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROB (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls back from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly, puzzled) OK... well, goodnight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. He turns back for his room, catching sight o has come out of Nikki's room, to investigate, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey is out on the second floor balcony exercising vigo one else is in evidence until a bedroom window flies open naked from the waist up and believing herself unwatched, stretches, breathing in the sweet morning air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she sees Harvey grinning at her. She quickly covers pulls back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob and Kit are the first ones down. They enter from the surprising Muffy at the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffy turns abruptly, startled. Rob and Kit stop abruptly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffy is barefooted, dressed in an old, worn chenille rob Her hair, normally carefully groomed, is unkempt, wild an about her pale face. Talk about unguarded moments. Her pr appearance, is the last way one would ever expect to find John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrinks back from them with a frightened, apologetic Scrambled eggs bubble in the skillet on the burner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I was hungry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bumps against the stove, backing away. She self-consc hand through her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUFFY (cont.) I... I must look a mess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scuttles out the door to the utility room and the bac beyond, leaving the eggs to burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch encounters her, too, as he comes bounding down in hi shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning! She backs away from him, scurrying up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... forgot to get dressed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch enters, joining his wonderment to Rob and Kit's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who made her night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch, Chaz, Harvey and Nikki burst out the door in old cl sweats, shorts, whatever -- an unlikely foursome for some soccer scrimmaging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (always in search of more players) Where's Skip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends on what he's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob and Kit cross their path, heading down to the water i swimsuits and overshirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasingly, an invitation) Nan? What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nan watches from the porch, book in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I thought I'd wait and see what Muffy wanted to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch shrugs and the soccer free-for-all begins in earnest special attention given to the interplay between Harvey a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on the porch, Nan finally sees Muffy emerging from the shed. Muffy is dressed plainly, oddly conventional, with sense of disorder about her. She keeps to herself, turnin woods beyond, with cutting blade and mushroom basket in h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nan puts down her book, hurrying off the porch. But by th looks up again, Muffy is gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob and Kit are standing together on the dock. He is drip covered with goose flesh. She has not been in yet. And wh vigorously toweling off his arms and chest, trying to get circulating again, she stands behind him with another tow gently, lovingly dries his back. She finishes and he step her and gazes out across the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear it wasn't this cold yesterday .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't what she meant, and he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you giving up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to her; gently) What about you? What about your future? You're the one wi point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...maybe it's crazy--you investing so much energy in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm scared. I don't know if I want what Mom everybody else expects of me. I don't want to go to law s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a great mind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...only it's not made up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling sadly, he crosses to her, puts his arms around he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great... Do you realize how perfectly unmatched we are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's made up about one thing though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What's that? She looks up and kisses him softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you feel the same about me a year from now? Two year from now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his hand and leads him down the pier and into t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they come inside. Kit closes the door, and immediately each other's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surging waves swirl beneath them, visible through the floorboards. Rob and Kit stretch out. All the passion, al tenderness, all the intensity makes them oblivious to the something is moving on the water below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when Kit finally opens her eyes to it, Skip's face bu gruesomely up at her through the slatted floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit screams and scrambles to her feet--Rob completely unc until he sees it too: Skip's body, pale and bloodied, dra the grungy skiff passing beneath them on the waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time he pulls on his swimsuit and comes rushing ou with Kit, however, Rob's shock has turned to rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip! You sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's no response, Skip's body unmoving on the self skiff which continues bobbing out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: starts to wonder whether it really is a joke. He hurries plunging 'into the water to reach the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip... Skip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's too far and getting farther, and the waves are t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob and Kit come struggling up the path. Chaz trains his them from the porch . He, Arch, Harvey and Nikki unwind w sandwiches after their sweaty workout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (commentary while he tapes) Respectable young Quaker couple returning after quiet aft nonviolent sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Skip? Anybody seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, can't you give me a straight answer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit up with the force. Nan comes out on the porch, h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw him... on a boat... drifting by the pier. He wasn' looked dead... unless he was joking...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it was Skip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw his face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anybody seen him since last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all realize they haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROB (cont .) Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob turns, rushing into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob stops as he notices, near the foot of the stairs wher it upon first entering the house yesterday afternoon, Ski bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and bounds up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob runs down to Skip's door and flings it open. A cheap hobgoblin drops suddenly in front of him, suspended from on frail, metal springs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob jumps back with a startled cry, then angrily tears th of his way and throws it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last of Muffy's little April Fool's gags, and overnight bag, it signifies that Skip has been nowhere ne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Rob steps inside and looks around just to make sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is untouched, the bed unslept in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob hurries out, as Muffy finally appears, emerging from grounds, basketful of mushrooms in hand. She approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing their distress ) Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob rushes by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I'll go with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rob, Arch and Chaz come running down to the water. The look around, seeing nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aloud: for Skip) Hey, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Look at this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has found on the little pebbled beach beside the dock, switchblade. It is in pieces. There's blood on the broken

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was Skip's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? That guy on the ferry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know what to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we go looking for him, him or Skip. One of them's b be around... somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean split up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not take any chances. He was... He was pretty big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sucker's taken me yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rips a loose board off the dock for a club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the gathering twilight, Muffy puts the basket of mushr a shelf. Someone grabs her wrist. She gasps. It's Nan. Na the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know why you're avoiding me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it's your idea of a joke... that's why you invite you find out? From one of his preppy 'friends'? Who else told?... Who else knows, except the father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? The tape just got there? You know very well... my abo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes apart, in tears. Muffy stares, uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NAN (cont.) I thought you wanted to be friends... you think you can p people's feelings just because you're rich and can do wha Well, you can't...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes out the rear door. Muffy tries to recover, con

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues on to the back entrance to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swinging open the door, she almost runs into Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... I was just checkin' to make sure everybody was a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He beats a hasty retreat the other way, passing Nikki on Nikki raises an eyebrow at Muffy, misinterpreting the ten air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey? No kidding'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that explains your clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you, mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffy exits hurriedly, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The path is narrow and tortuous . Arch uses his club to c trying to follow its twists and turns. He also tries to m contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, shithead! chickendick!... yeah, you! Skip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves deeper and deeper into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead on the pathway a thick, black viper slithers out undergrowth, stops, sensing Arch's presence, and coils it his approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Arch stalks forward, not looking at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch steps right over the snake and continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Arch hears a noise. He stops. SOMEONE ELSE is here wit nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and moves back along the trail, peering into the foliage on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he steps over the snake again going back the other way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops again, looks all around him, then turns once mor to move very slowly with short little steps back in the o direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is edging closer and closer to the snake. He is bound this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snake coils itself to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch's foot comes down just missing it, less than six inc when suddenly the ground seems to move. A noose springs u around his ankle, and Arch is lifted into the air upside swinging wildly, dropping his club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the viper strikes, and Arch sees it. He is shrieking as he tries to bat the creature away from him. But he kee into it, and the snake keeps striking at him, trying to f opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a long, gleaming blade ENTERS FRAME and chops th two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch looks up, his face white and frozen into a mask of s no longer able even to scream

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit, Nikki and Harvey are waiting on the back porch when from the woods nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to him) No Skip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz now comes out of the woods on the other side of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Arch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this... I definitely don't think I like this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's about time we called the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen door BANGS again. They look up. It's Muffy. Sh their stares stiffly, without expression . She holds flow hand shears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight-two-four-eight. Constable Potter has an office at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we should wait any longer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob moves into the house past Muffy. Kit follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUFFY (to be played like Muffy) Who wants some tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll calm our nerves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits toward the kitchen . Nikki. perplexed by her be strangely after her.

dialogues.speaker: EXT . GROUNDS OF HOUSE
dialogues.text: Nan sits alone on a stone bench beside a small Buddha sta secluded corner of the garden behind the house. She has b Her face tells the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a gentle wind springs up rustling the leaves of the t surrounding her. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob is on the phone trying to reach the Constable. He han receiver, then lifts it and starts toВ· dial again. Kit, beside him. now wanders silently off into the dining room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kit enters, Muffy comes in from the pantry, breathless apologetic, her hands full of tea boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know what kind anybody would like so I just... g all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he reached the Constable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob? No, we haven 't been able to get through to the main

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffy eases. Kit turns the tap to fill the kettle. The pi BANG. The tap sputters and coughs out a spurt of brown wa running dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... В·the main... it's probably broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki and Harvey enter, having heard the pipes banging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens sometime... But there's still the well all the have some kind of pump... or well... for emergencies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki reaches for a large flashlight beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. I'll go. Just point me in the right direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey accompanies Nikki out the back door, leaving Kit a alone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bearing up under Kit's stare) I'm not worried. I'm sure those two... Skip and Art... th to some kind of stupid trick . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit moves out of the kitchen uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki milkes ghost sound8, following Harvey out through t makes him nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you should really do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The well is the old-fashioned kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKKI (cont.) Boy, when she said `well,' she really meant 'well'. who d thing? Pocahontas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for the wooden bucket attached by metal nook rope. Harvey pre-empts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me do it. I've probably had more experience tha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, back home on the farm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you think I'm a hick, but I'd like to change your that, if you'd only give me the chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, I'd really like to plow your field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draw me some water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's glad to oblige, opening the hinged wood well cover a the bucket slowly. The dark hole seems to go on forever. there's a muffled CLATTER deep within the well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, crap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal. The rope was rotten, any fool coulda seen that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, shine your light down so I can get a fix on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises on her toes, flashing the powerful beam down th Harvey bends over to look. A rotted piece of the well cov in his hand. He lurches forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... oh, Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams back in ashen horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back! Don't look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a big girl now. I think I В·can handle a few spiders

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shines the beam down again, bending in for a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She should've listened to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nan's body lies twisted and jammed among the slime. Her d revealing a white breast with veins of blood streaming ac into the water. Next to her, Arch's severed head gapes up grin, joined in its leer by Skip's decapitated head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like the very guts have been torn out of her. She sc stumbling back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rob runs up, everyone else is already there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the well ! Oh, God, the well!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob grabs the flashlight from Chaz's hands and leaps up t look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long, horrifying glimpse he has to step back to c overwhelming nausea. He shudders violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to leave, all of us, we have to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closing the well cover) We can't get away. Everyone back into the house . Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking in through the windows we can see Rob alone in th still trying the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANNING ACROSS to the dining room windows, we see Nikki s table with Kit and Chaz on either side of her. Harvey sta them against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit is trying to comfort Nikki who is still in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Nikki. With the others... they were outdoors. inside now, and we're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all because of what happened on the ferry, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident. Don't they know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffy enters from the kitchen with a glass of water. Harv quietly aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffy, where do you keep your guns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guns? We don't keep guns in this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others turn and look back at them. There is an uncomf pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing Nikki the glass) Here.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI ,
dialogues.text: Oh, God! Not the water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. It's Perrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the phone rings O. S. They all look toward the l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Buffy?... please, we didn't mean any harm... we're leavin want to go home... please... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter.

dialogues.text: Look, next month I get the house as part of my inheritanc but only if I can show my father that it can carry itself taxes and expenses. Otherwise, he'll just sell it out of So, I'm planning on turning it into a country inn. Not ju stuffy old run-of-the-mill country inn, but one that spec offering once-in-a lifetime Whodunit Weekends. I needed a had to try out the idea on somebody.

dialogues.text: Well, if the food's any indication, it's already half-way

dialogues.text: I've learned a lot, Muffy, I really have. I suppose I sho you, but I don't think I would be able to without it soun So I'll just say goodbye. (beat; an afterthought) Thanks for showing me your house.

dialogues.text: She turns and crosses to the van and climbs aboard. The o their last goodbyes. Muffy waves, and then they are gone turns and walks forlornly back into her house.

dialogues.text: Cal, I want to thank you personally. You've been a real s this.

dialogues.text: Yes, that's the way.

dialogues.text: This time, no funny business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than this a couple of days ago.

dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.text: I'll tell you what I've learned from all this. I'm tired fling after another. I don't want any more of that. I wan boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Rob turns away from Skip now, steps over and surveys the

dialogues.text: Well, it's like pranks really piss people off. It unleash you know? Makes any kind of behavior possible, and we acc

dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.text: What really amazes me is how easy we made it for her. Eve just out for himself. We could've stopped Muffy cold if w stuck together, if we'd only worked like a team.

dialogues.text: Yeah, she really got us good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I know what I'd do, if I wasn't her brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost without thinking) Go back and give her a taste of her own medicine, that's should do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki steps. Leeks up, hearing herself. Skip returns the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
